concept.title: Level 2 Cache Tutorial
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes how to configure the base port to use the ARM L210 cache or L220 cache controllers in ARM processors.

conbody.p: Cache is a fast buffer that keeps copies of recently accessed memory.

section.title: L210 Cache
section.p: In the variant.mmh file, set the macro:
You must also set a L210 Cache macro and initialise Level 2 cache in the Bootstrap. See Level 2 Cache Macros and HardwareInitialise().
The L210 cache is switched on by generic Symbian OS code before jumping into the kernel code. The cache is switched on after the MMU and L1 cache are enabled.

section.title: L220 Cache
section.p: In the variant.mmh file, set the macro:
You must also set a L220 Cache macro and initialise Level 2 cache in the Bootstrap. See Level 2 Cache Macros and HardwareInitialise().
Code to switch on the L220 cache on must be provided by the base port. You can do this in the HardwareInitialise() function or the BTF_Final() function in the Bootstrap.
